titleStmt.title: The tryal and condemnation of several notorious malefactors, at a sessions of oyer and terminer which began at the Sessions House in the Old Baily with the names of those who received sentence of death, burnt in the hand, transported, and to be whipt. And most remarkably of John Sadler, who whipt the child to death at Ratcliffe.

The tryal and condemnation of several notorious malefactors, at a sessions of oyer and terminer which began at the Sessions House in the Old Baily with the names of those who received sentence of death, burnt in the hand, transported, and to be whipt. And most remarkably of John Sadler, who whipt the child to death at Ratcliffe.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Court of Quarter Sessions of the Peace (London)

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University Library.
